cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CV, cs.CL 

Reasoning: The paper proposes a machine learning framework for evaluating creativity in various domains, which involves regression-based learning and the use of quantitative measures for essential criteria of creativity. This suggests that the paper could belong to several sub-categories related to machine learning, such as cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper involves the use of data from IMDb and Rotten Tomatoes, which suggests that it could also belong to sub-categories related to information retrieval (cs.IR) and computer vision (cs.CV). Finally, the paper involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques for analyzing movie reviews, which suggests that it could also belong to the sub-category of computational linguistics (cs.CL).
